description.narrative: C4D Strategies to address issues related to child rights are developed and applied., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 8. Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: C4D Strategies to address issues related to child rights are developed and applied.

description.narrative: Following the polio outbreak in two districts in Zambia, UNICEF trained, equipped and funded Community-based Volunteers (CBVs) responsible for the social mobilisation for the polio Supplementary Immunization Activity (SIA) campaign. Round one reached 99.7% of the target 140,926 children under-five. UNICEF also supported social mobilisation activities in the response, following measles outbreaks in six provinces and cholera outbreaks in four districts in Zambia. UNICEF supported Ministry of Health (MoH) to finalise the Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) preparedness plan. UNICEF also completed three studies on knowledge, attitude and practice (KAP) that will inform design of communication for development programmes in Zambia. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019
